intro: Cirrhaea warreana, commonly known as the Warrean cirrhaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
